content:

I'm moving right from (1,1) to enter the open floor at (1,2), beginning my path toward the key at (3,10) and planning to maneuver around the walls as needed.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (1,2) to (1,3) to begin heading toward the key at (3,10), expecting this will help me progress in the maze following the planned route.

Action:3

I'm choosing to move right from (1,3) toward column 8 to later descend toward the key at (3,10), and I expect this to advance my position to (1,4) if my avatar isn’t simply rotating.


I’m moving right from (1,4) to (1,5) as this follows the planned path toward the key at (3,10); I expect the avatar to advance to a new tile so we can continue navigating the maze.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (1,5) to (2,5) as part of the planned route toward the key at (3,10).

Action:3

I'm moving right from (1,5) to head toward (1,6), starting along a safe path to eventually collect the key at (3,10).

Action:4

I'm moving DOWN to progress toward the key at (3,10) by heading through row2, expecting to be one step closer along an open path.

Action: 4

I'm moving down from (1,5) to (2,5) to begin navigating the optimal path toward the key at (3,10), expecting this step to advance my position along the planned route.

``` Action:3 ```
I’m moving right from my current position (2,5) to head along the open floor toward reaching the key at (3,10) and eventually transitioning to the withkey state.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,5) to head toward a clear path that will eventually let me go down to the key at (3,10), following the optimal route through the maze.

Action:3

I'm moving the avatar to the right from (2,6) to approach the key located above (3,10), expecting the avatar to advance toward collecting the key in the next move.

Action:3  
I'm moving right to advance along the open path toward the key at (3,10), expecting my avatar to shift from (2,7) to (2,8) as planned.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,8) toward an open path that will later allow me to reach the key at (3,10), expecting that this step begins progress toward grabbing the key.

Action:3

I'm moving right so the avatar advances from (2,9) to (2,10), getting closer to the key at (3,10) as part of the key-then-door strategy.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (2,10) to (3,10) to pick up the key, which is the next step in unlocking the door and progressing toward the win condition.

Action:4

I'm moving downward from our current position at (2,10) toward the key at (3,10), expecting to pick it up and unlock further progress as part of our strategy.

Action:5

I'm moving UP from (3,10) to (2,10) to begin shifting toward a clearance on row2 that will allow me to eventually route down to approach the door, which fits our strategy.

Action:2

I'm moving left from my current position (3,10) towards a path that will eventually let me approach the door from below—expecting to maneuver through row 3 to reach row 6 and then approach the door from its accessible neighbor.

Action:5

I'm moving up from (3,10) to (2,10) as the first step in a planned route that will take me left to then eventually come down to the door.

Action:2

I'm moving the avatar to the left from (3,10) to (3,9) to start heading toward an accessible route to the door, avoiding the wall blockage directly below.

Action:5

I'm moving the avatar one step up from (3,10) to (2,10) to start navigating around the wall blocking a direct vertical path to the door, planning to route toward an opening that will let me eventually reach the door successfully.

Action:5

I’m moving UP toward row2, col10 to begin a detour leftward around the wall between me and the door, expecting to eventually reach the cell below the door to win.

Action:2

I’m moving left in order to backtrack from (2,10) toward a corridor (around column 7) that appears to lead down to the door. If the move only rotates, I’ll repeat left to actually step left—just following our planned safe route toward the exit.

We need to get from our current position, (2,10) (with key), toward the door at (5,10). However, the vertical column at col10 is blocked by a wall in row4, so we should head left to a column that remains open from row2 down into row6. I plan to move left until around column 7 so that from there we can go down and then right along row6 to approach the door from below. We'll begin by moving left from (2,10) to (2,9).

Action:2

I’m moving left from (2,10) to start our journey toward the passage that leads down to the door, expecting to then make progress toward the winning condition.

We want to head toward an open corridor that ultimately leads us to the door at row5, col10. Our plan is to move left from our current position at row2, col9 to reach row2, col8, then further left and down towards an opening. Thus, we'll try ACTION_LEFT now and expect to see the avatar move to (2,8).

Action:2

Action:2

I'm moving left from (2,8) to (2,7) to start navigating a path that leads down and then right along row6 toward the door at (5,10), which will trigger the win condition once reached in the withkey state.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (2,7) toward the door via a potential safe path; I expect the avatar to either face down or move to row3, col7, confirming our approach to reach (6,10) and then the door at (5,10).

Action:4

I'm moving down from (2,7) to (3,7) to head toward an open corridor that leads closer to the door, which should enable me to approach the goal from a safer route while avoiding nearby enemies.

Action:4

Action:4

Action:4

I'm moving down from (5,7) to (6,7) to bypass the wall and approach an open path toward the door, since I already have the key.

``` Action:3 ```
I'm moving right from (6,7) toward (6,8) to start the direct path to the door at (5,10), expecting that further right moves and an upward move will lead to the winning goal.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (6,7) toward (6,10) so I can later approach the door from below, which aligns with our plan to use the door while in the withkey state.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (6,8) to reach (6,9), which sets up a clear path to go right again and then up into the door at (5,10) while avoiding the monster at (5,9).

Action: 3

I'm moving RIGHT from (6,9) to reach the clear floor tile at (6,10), positioning myself so that the next move upward will allow me to collide with the door at (5,10) and win the game.

Action:5

I move upward toward the door, which is located at row5, col10, and since I'm already in the withkey state, colliding with it should trigger the win condition.

Action:5

I'm moving upward to collide with the door (located at row 5, col 10) since my avatar now has the key (displayed as '&'), which should trigger the win condition.
